section.title: Overview
section.p: The bulk of administrative tasks are done through the Web SSO Admin Console. The correct URL must be used. The console may be accessed directly at https://<smhostserver>:8666/auth/admin/ with the user credentials created in the add-user-keycloak script in the bin directory. This would further redirect to the Web SSO Admin Console.: If the master realm user forgets their password, the add-user-keycloak script may be used to create a new administrator of the master realm.

The right-most drop-down menu on the admin console allows the administrator to view the user account or logout from the current session. To enquire about a certain feature, button, or field within the Web SSO Admin Console, simply hover the mouse over any question mark ? icon which pops up the tool-tip text to describe the area of the console of interest.

This section allows the selection of the sps-auth realm, configure realm settings, clients, client scopes, roles, identity providers, user federation, and authentication using the Web SSO Admin Console.When a Geo-redundant pair of Service Managers (SMs) are installed and changes are done on the KeyCloak for any of these sites, the caches must be cleared (realm, user, and key cache) on the other site to reflect the same changes. The only time that this does not need be done is the creation and deletion of users, roles, and user-role mapping which gets reflected without the need to clear the cache. The changes may include creation, deletion and modification on password policies, user attributes, clients, events etc. To clear the caches, do the following:
Select the realm on which the changes were made.
Go to "Realm Settings" -> "Cache‚Äù.
Click the "Clear" button for all three caches (Realm Cache, User Cache, and Keys Cache).
